sen.j: 京都師範学校 （きょうとしはんがっこう） は第二次世界大戦中の1943年 （昭和18年） に、京都府に設置された師範学校である。
sen.e: Kyoto Normal School (teacher's training school) was established in Kyoto Prefecture, during the World War Ⅱ in 1943.
Kyoto Normal School (teacher's training school) was established in Kyoto Prefecture, during World War Ⅱ in 1943.

sen.j: 本項は、京都府師範学校・京都府女子師範学校などの前身諸校を含めて記述する。
sen.e: This term describes Kyoto Normal School, including its predecessor such as the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and Women's Normal School of Kyoto.
This term describes the Kyoto Normal School, including its predecessors such as the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and the Women's Normal School of Kyoto.

sen.j: 京都府師範学校・京都府女子師範学校の統合・官立移管により設置された。
sen.e: Kyoto Normal School was established, after the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and Women's Normal School of Kyoto was merged and transferred to the governmental jurisdiction.

sen.j: 男子部・女子部を置いた。
sen.e: It had Men's Division and Girl's Division.

sen.e: It had a boys division and a girls division.

sen.j: 1876年 （明治9年） 創立の京都府師範学校を起源とする。
sen.e: Kyoto Normal School had its roots in the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture, which was established in 1876.
The Kyoto Normal School had its roots in the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture, which was established in 1876.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後の学制改革で新制京都学芸大学 （現・京都教育大学） の母体の一つとなった。
sen.e: After the World War Ⅱ, with the educational system reform, Kyoto Normal School became one of the parent body of new-education-system Kyoto Gakugei University (present Kyoto University of Education).

After World War Ⅱ, with the educational system reform, Kyoto Normal School became one of the parent bodies of the new-education-system Kyoto Gakugei University (present Kyoto University of Education).

sen.e: February 14, 1876: The Governor of Kyoto, Masanao UEMURA submitted a letter of inquiry concerning the foundation of Normal School to Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) Sanetsune TOKUDAIJI..

sen.e: Two-year elementary school teacher training course was established, using Jugosato Goten Palace in Kyoto Imperial Ishiyakushi- Gate as a temporary campus.

sen.j: 京都府師範学校は男子校となった。

sen.j: 1909年5月： 校歌制定。
sen.e: May, 1909: School song was made.

sen.j: 『紫野辺の暑さにも』 （黒本植 作詞、吉田恒三 作曲）。

sen.j: 1911年4月： 「入学試験事件」 発生。
sen.e: April 1911: "Entrance Examination Incident" occurred.
April 1911: "Entrance Examination Incident" occurred.

sen.j: 本科第二部に同志社普通部卒の4名が志願した。
sen.e: Four Doshisya regular course graduates applied for the regular course second department.
Four Doshisya regular course graduates applied for the regular course second department.
Four Doshisha regular course graduates applied for the regular course second department.

sen.j: 中学校令による中学校でないため科目免除が受けられず （志願者側の認識と異なった）、結局全員が不合格となった。
sen.e: They couldn't receive an exemption of examination subjects (against their recognition), because the course they applied for wasn't established under the Higher Middle School Ordinance, and eventually all four students were rejected.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They couldn't receive an exemption of examination subjects (against their recognition), because the course they applied for wasn't established under the Higher Middle School Ordinance, and eventually all four students were rejected.

They couldn't receive an exemption of examination subjects (against their recognition), because they had not graduated from a middle school established under the Higher Middle School Ordinance, and eventually all four students were rejected.
sen.cmt: 「中学校令による中学でない」は同志社のことだと解釈しました。

sen.j: しかし、師範学校校長が 「同志社はキリスト教学校なので、入学して来てもらっては困る」 と発言した旨の誤報道がなされた。
sen.e: However, false report was made that the head of Normal School said he didn't want to accept students from the Christian School, Doshisya.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 1899年4月： 愛宕郡上賀茂村字小山に新築移転。
sen.e: April, 1899: It was relocated to a new building in Kamigamomura Aza Koyama, Otagi County.
April, 1899: It was relocated to a new building in Kamigamomura Aza Koyama, Otagi County.
April, 1899: It was relocated to a new building in Kamigamo-mura Aza Koyama, Otagi County.

sen.j: 京都府女子師範学校
sen.e: Women's Normal School of Kyoto
Women's Normal School of Kyoto
Women's Normal School of Kyoto

sen.j: 1908年4月1日： 京都府師範学校女子部が分離独立し京都府女子師範学校開校 （京都府告示第72号）。
sen.e: April 1, 1908: the Normal School Girls' Division of Kyoto Prefecture became independent from the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and opened Women's Normal School of Kyoto (Notification No.72 of Kyoto Prefecture).

April 1, 1908: the Normal School Girls' Division of Kyoto Prefecture became independent from the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and opened the Women's Normal School of Kyoto (Notification No.72 of Kyoto Prefecture).

April 1, 1908: the Normal School Girls' Division of Kyoto Prefecture became independent from the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and opened the Women's Normal School of Kyoto (Notification No.72 of Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 本科第一部 （4年制。3年制高等小学校卒対象）・本科第二部 （1年制。高等女学校卒対象） を設置。
sen.e: Regular course primary department (4－year course, and intended for 3-year highly elementary school graduates) and regular course secondly department (1-year course, and intended for girl's high school graduates) were established.

Regular course primary department (4-year course, and intended for 3-year upper elementary school graduates) and the regular course secondly department (1-year course, and intended for girl's high school graduates) were established.

Regular course primary department (four-year course, and intended for three-year upper elementary school graduates) and the regular course secondly department (one-year course, and intended for girl's high school graduates) were established.

sen.j: 上京区吉田町、私立吉田中学校旧校舎を仮校舎として発足。
sen.e: Women's Normal School of Kyoto was launched, using the former school building of Yoshida junior high school in Yoshida-machi Kamigyo Ward as its temporally school house.
Women's Normal School of Kyoto was launched, using the former school building of Yoshida junior high school in Yoshida-machi Kamigyo Ward as its temporary school house.
Women's Normal School of Kyoto was launched, using the former private school building of Yoshida junior high school in Yoshida-machi, Kamigyo Ward as its temporary school house.
sen.cmt: of の前と文頭のスペース短縮「私立」 訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.j: 京都市第一高等小学校・第二錦林尋常小学校を代用附属とする。
sen.e: Kyoto City Daiichi Higher Elementary School and Daini Kinrin Elementary School became affiliated with Women's Normal School of Kyoto.
Kyoto City Daiichi Higher Elementary School and Daini Kinrin Elementary School became affiliated with the Women's Normal School of Kyoto.
Kyoto City Daiichi Higher Elementary School and Daini Kinrin Elementary School became affiliated with the Women's Normal School of Kyoto.

sen.j: 1910年4月： 愛宕郡大宮村字紫竹 （現・京都市北区） の新校舎に移転。
sen.e: April, 1910: It was replaced to a new school building in Omiya-mura aza Shichiku, Otagi county (now Kita Ward, Kyoto City).
April, 1910: It was moved to a new school building in Omiya-mura aza Shichiku, Otagi county (now Kita Ward, Kyoto City).
April, 1910: It was moved to a new school building in Omiya-mura aza Shichiku, Otagi county (now Kita Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 大宮村立待鳳尋常高等小学校を附属小学校とする。
sen.e: Omiya Prefectural Taiho Jinjo Higher Elementary School became affiliated with Women's Normal School of Kyoto.
Omiya Prefectural Taiho Jinjo Higher Elementary School became affiliated with the Women's Normal School of Kyoto.
Omiya Prefectural Taiho Jinjo Higher Elementary School became affiliated with the Women's Normal School of Kyoto.

sen.j: 1917年12月： 紀伊郡伏見町堀内村の農事試験場跡へ移転 （移転告示は1918年1月）。
sen.e: December, 1917: It was moved to Fushimi-cho Horiuchi-mura Kii county, the site where the agricultural experiment station previously stood.
December, 1917: It was moved to Fushimi-cho Horiuchi-mura Kii county, the site where the agricultural experiment station previously stood.
December, 1917: It was moved to Fushimi-cho Horiuchi-mura Kii county, the site where the agricultural experiment station previously stood (the relocation announcement was made in January, 1918.)
sen.cmt: （移転告示は1918年1月） 訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.j: 現・京都市伏見区桃山井伊掃部東町、京都教育大学附属桃山中学校所在地。
sen.e: Now Momoyama Junior High School Attached to Kyoto University of Education is located in this are (Iikamonhigashi-machi Fushimi Ward Kyoto City)
Now the Momoyama Junior High School Attached to the Kyoto University of Education is located in this area (Iikamonhigashi-machi Fushimi Ward Kyoto City).
Now the Momoyama Junior High School Attached to the Kyoto University of Education is located in this area (Momoyama Iikamonhigashi-machi Fushimi Ward Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: 「桃山」 訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.j: 1918年4月： 府立桃山高等女学校 （現・京都府立桃山高等学校） を併設。
sen.e: April, 1918: Kyoto Prefectural Momoyama Girls' High School (present Kyoto Prefectural Momoyama High School) was attached to Women's Normal School of Kyoto.
April, 1918: Kyoto Prefectural Momoyama Girls' High School (present Kyoto Prefectural Momoyama High School) was attached to the Women's Normal School of Kyoto.
April, 1918: Kyoto Prefectural Momoyama Girls' High School (present Kyoto Prefectural Momoyama High School) was attached to the Women's Normal School of Kyoto.

sen.j: 同月、伏見住吉幼稚園・伏見第三尋常小学校を附属校に充当。
sen.e: In the same month, Fushimi Sumiyoshi Kindergarten and Fushimi Daisan Elementary School became affiliated with Women's Normal School of Kyoto,
In the same month, Fushimi Sumiyoshi Kindergarten and Fushimi Daisan Elementary School became affiliated with the Women's Normal School of Kyoto,
In the same month, Fushimi Sumiyoshi Kindergarten and Fushimi Daisan Jinjo Elementary School became affiliated with the Women's Normal School of Kyoto,

sen.j: 1921年2月： 本科第二部の修業年限を1年4ヶ月に延長。
sen.e: February, 1921: Term of the regular course secondary division was extended to one year and four months.
February, 1921: Term of the regular course secondary division was extended to one year and four months.
February, 1921: Term of the regular course secondary division was extended to one year and four months.

sen.j: 1925年4月： 本科第一部を5年制に変更。
sen.e: April, 1925: Term of Regular course primary department was changed to five years.
April, 1925: Term of Regular course primary department was changed to five years.
April, 1925: Term of Regular course primary department was changed to five years.

sen.j: 1926年4月： 専攻科を開設 （1年制）。
sen.e: April, 1926: Non-degree course (one-year) for graduates was opened.
April, 1926: Non-degree course (one-year) for graduates was opened.
April, 1926: Non-degree course (one-year) for graduates was opened.

sen.j: 1943年4月1日： 京都府師範学校・京都府女子師範学校を統合・官立移管し、京都師範学校設置。
sen.e: April 1, 1943: After Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and Women's Normal School of Kyoto were merged and transferred to the governmental jurisdiction, Kyoto Normal School was established.
April 1, 1943: After the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and the Women's Normal School of Kyoto were merged and transferred to government jurisdiction, the Kyoto Normal School was established.
April 1, 1943: After the Normal School of Kyoto Prefecture and the Women's Normal School of Kyoto were merged and transferred to government jurisdiction, the Kyoto Normal School was established.

sen.j: 旧京都府師範学校校舎に男子部、旧京都府女子師範学校校舎に女子部を設置。
sen.e: Its Men's Division was established in the school house of former Kyoto Prefectural Normal School, while its Women's Division was established in the school house of former Women's Normal School of Kyoto.

Its Men's Division was established in the school house of former the Kyoto Prefectural Normal School, while its Women's Division was established in the school house of the former Women's Normal School of Kyoto.

Its Men's Division was established in the school house of the former Kyoto Prefectural Normal School, while its Women's Division was established in the school house of the former Women's Normal School of Kyoto.

sen.j: 本科 （3年制。旧制中等教育学校卒対象）・予科 （高等小学校卒対象） を設置。
sen.e: Regular course (three-year course, intended for secondary education school under the old educational system graduates) and preparatory course (intended for higher elementary school graduates) were established.

The regular course (three-year course, intended for graduates of secondary education schools under the old educational system) and preparatory course (intended for upper elementary school graduates) were established.

The regular course (three-year course, intended for graduates of secondary education schools under the old educational system) and preparatory course (intended for upper elementary school graduates) were established.

sen.j: 1943年6月6日： 開講式を挙行。
sen.e: June 6, 1943: Its opening ceremony was held.
June 6, 1943: Its opening ceremony was held.
June 6, 1943: Its opening ceremony was held.

sen.j: 1947年4月： 横田校長着任。
sen.e: April, 1947: Mr. Yokota became the school head of Kyoto Normal School.
April, 1947: Mr. Yokota became the school head of Kyoto Normal School.
April, 1947: Mr. Yokota became the school head of Kyoto Normal School.

sen.j: 広域合併による大学昇格をにらみ、滋賀師範学校・奈良師範学校と協議。
sen.e: The school held a talk with Shiga Normal School and Nara Normal School, aiming to get university status by large-scale merger of schools.
The school held a talk with Shiga Normal School and Nara Normal School, aiming to get university status by a large-scale merger of schools.
The school held a talk with Shiga Normal School and Nara Normal School, aiming to get university status by a large-scale merger of schools.
sen.cmt: a の後のスペース短縮

sen.j: 1948年2月： 校長、文部省の一県一大学方針により、京都大学事務局長と折衝。
sen.e: February, 1948: The principal negotiated with executive secretary of Kyoto University, due to the Ministry of Education's one-national-university-in-one-prefecture policy.
February, 1948: The principal negotiated with the executive secretary of Kyoto University, due to the Ministry of Education's one-national-university-in-one-prefecture policy.
February, 1948: The principal negotiated with the executive secretary of Kyoto University, due to the Ministry of Education's one-national-university-in-one-prefecture policy.

sen.j: 京都大学側には合併計画のないことを確認。
sen.e: It was confirmed that Kyoto University didn't have any merger plan.
It was confirmed that Kyoto University didn't have any merger plan.
It was confirmed that Kyoto University didn't have any merger plan.

sen.j: 京都青年師範学校 （青師） は京大農学部への併合を希望していたため、京都師範単独での大学昇格を決断。
sen.e: Since Kyoto Young Men's Normal School hoped to merge with Kyoto University Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto Normal School decided to get university status by itself.
Since Kyoto Young Men's Normal School hoped to merge with the Kyoto University Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto Normal School decided to get university status by itself.
Since Kyoto Young Men's Normal School hoped to merge with the Kyoto University Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto Normal School decided to get university status by itself.

sen.j: 1948年4月： 昇格準備委員会発足。
sen.e: April, 1948: Committee of preparing for promotion was established.
April, 1948: A committee for promotion prepping was established.
April, 1948: A committee for promotion prepping was established.

sen.j: 1948年6月： 青師の京大農学部ブランチ案が流れ、青師と合同での昇格に変更。
sen.e: June, 1948: After Kyoto Young Men's Normal School's plan to become a branch school of Kyoto University Faculty of Agriculture was canceled, Kyoto Normal School worked together with kyoto Young Men's Normal School to get university status.

June, 1948: After Kyoto Young Men's Normal School's plan to become a branch school of the Kyoto University Faculty of Agriculture was canceled, Kyoto Normal School worked together with Kyoto Young Men's Normal School to get university status.

June, 1948: After Kyoto Young Men's Normal School's plan to become a branch school of the Kyoto University Faculty of Agriculture was canceled, Kyoto Normal School worked together with Kyoto Young Men's Normal School to get university status.

sen.j: 1949年5月31日： 新制京都学芸大学発足。
sen.e: May 31, 1949: Kyoto Gakugei University was established under the new educational system.
May 31, 1949: Kyoto Gakugei University was established under the new educational system.
May 31, 1949: Kyoto Gakugei University was established under the new educational system.

sen.j: 京都師範学校は青師と共に母体として包括された。
sen.e: Both Kyoto Normal School and Kyoto Young Men's Normal School were merged with Kyoto Gakugei University as its parent body.
Both Kyoto Normal School and Kyoto Young Men's Normal School were merged with Kyoto Gakugei University as its parent body.
Both Kyoto Normal School and Kyoto Young Men's Normal School were merged with Kyoto Gakugei University as its parent body.

sen.j: 旧・男子部校地に大学本部、旧・女子部校地に桃山分校、旧・青師校地に高原分教場を設置。
sen.e: Head office of the University was established in former Men's Division school grounds, Momoyama Branch School was established in former Women's Division, and Takahara Branch School was established in former Kyoto Young Men's Normal School.

The head office of the University was established in the former Men's Division school grounds, the Momoyama Branch School was established in the former Women's Division, and the Takahara Branch School was established in the former Kyoto Young Men's Normal School.

The head office of the University was established in the former Men's Division school grounds, the Momoyama Branch School was established in the former Women's Division, and the Takahara Branch School was established in the former Kyoto Young Men's Normal School.

sen.j: 1951年3月： 京都学芸大学京都師範学校 （旧制）、廃止。
sen.e: March, 1951: Kyoto Gakugei University Kyoto Normal School (under the old educational system) was discontinued.
March, 1951: Kyoto Gakugei University Kyoto Normal School (under the old educational system) was discontinued.
March, 1951: Kyoto Gakugei University Kyoto Normal School (under the old educational system) was discontinued.

tit.e: Relocation and takeover of school lands
Relocation and takeover of school lands
Relocation and takeover of school lands

sen.j: 京都師範学校男子部
sen.e: Kyoto Normal School, Men's Division
Kyoto Normal School, Men's Division
Kyoto Normal School, Men's Division

sen.j: 前身の京都府師範学校から引き継いだ京都市上京区 （現・京都市北区） 小山南大野町 （附属校は紫野東御所田町） の校地を使用した。
sen.e: Kyoto Normal School, Men's Division used the school land in Koyamaminami Ono-machi, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City (now Kita Ward, Kyoto City), which was taken over from its predecessor, Kyoto Prefectural Normal School (its affiliated school used the school land in Murasaki no Higashi Goshyoden-cho).

Kyoto Normal School, Men's Division used the school land in Koyamaminami Ono-machi, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City (now Kita Ward, Kyoto City), which was taken over by its predecessor, Kyoto Prefectural Normal School (its affiliated school used the school land in Murasaki no Higashi Goshyoden-cho).

Kyoto Normal School, Men's Division used the school land in Koyamaminami Ono-machi, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City (now Kita Ward, Kyoto City), which was taken over by its predecessor, Kyoto Prefectural Normal School (its affiliated school used the school land in Murasaki no Higashi Goshyoden-cho).

sen.j: 同校地は後身の新制京都学芸大学に引き継がれ、1957年9月に現在の伏見区深草藤森町 （大日本帝国陸軍歩兵第9連隊跡 → アメリカ軍キャンプ・フィッシャー跡） に移転するまで使用された。
sen.e: This school land was taken over by its successor, Kyoto Gakugei University established by the new educational system and used until it was relocated to present Fukakusa Fujinomori- cho, Fushimi Ward (the site on the 9th Infantry Regiment of Imperial Japanese Army => the site of U.S. military base, Camp Fisher) in September, 1957.

This school land was taken over by its successor, the Kyoto Gakugei University that established by the new educational system and used until it was relocated to present location, Fukakusa Fujinomori-cho, Fushimi Ward (the site of the 9th Infantry Regiment of the Imperial Japanese Army => the site of the U.S. military base, Camp Fisher) in September, 1957.

This school land was taken over by its successor, the Kyoto Gakugei University that established by the new educational system and used until it was relocated to present location, Fukakusa Fujinomori-cho, FushimiWard (the site of the nineth Infantry Regiment of the Imperial Japanese Army => the site of the U.S. military base, Camp Fisher) in September, 1957.

sen.j: 小山南大野町の旧校地は、現在は京都教育大学 （1966年に京都学芸大学から改称） 附属京都中学校の校地となっている。
sen.e: Former school land in Koyamaminami Ono-cho now became the school land of Kyoto Junior High School Attached to Kyoto University of Education (which was renamed from Kyoto Gakugei University in 1966).

The former school land in Koyamaminami Ono-cho became the school land of Kyoto Junior High School Attached to the Kyoto University of Education (which was renamed from Kyoto Gakugei University in 1966).

The former school land in Koyamaminami Ono-cho became the school land of Kyoto Junior High School Attached to the Kyoto University of Education (which was renamed from Kyoto Gakugei University in 1966).

sen.j: 隣接する附属京都小学校は、引き続き紫野東御所田町の校地を使用し続けている。
sen.e: Its adjacent Kyoto Elementary School attached to Kyoto University of Education has continued to use the land in Murasaki no Higashi Goshyoden-cho.
The adjacent Kyoto Elementary School attached to the Kyoto University of Education has continued to use the land in Murasaki no Higashi Goshyoden-cho.
The adjacent Kyoto Elementary School attached to the Kyoto University of Education has continued to use the land in Murasakino Higashi Goshyoden-cho.

sen.j: 京都師範学校女子部
sen.e: Kyoto Normal School, Women's Division
Kyoto Normal School, Women's Division
Kyoto Normal School, Women's Division

sen.j: 前身の京都府女子師範学校から引き継いだ京都市伏見区桃山町 （現・桃山井伊掃部東町） の校地を使用した。
sen.e: Kyoto Normal School Women's Division used the school land of its predecessor, Women's Normal School of Kyoto in Momoyama-cho Fushimi Ward, Kyoto-city (present Momoyama Iikaamon Higasi-machi).
Kyoto Normal School Women's Division used the school land of its predecessor, the Women's Normal School of Kyoto in Momoyama-cho Fushimi Ward, Kyoto-city (present Momoyama Iikaamon Higasi-machi).
Kyoto Normal School Women's Division used the school land of its predecessor, the Women's Normal School of Kyoto in Momoyama-cho Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City (present Momoyama Iikamon Higasi-machi).

sen.j: 同校地は後身の新制京都学芸大学に引き継がれ、桃山分校となった。
sen.e: This school land was taken over by new-education-system Kyoto Gakugei University and became Momoyama branch school.
This school land was taken over by the new-education-system Kyoto Gakugei University and became the Momoyama branch school.
This school land was taken over by the new-education-system Kyoto Gakugei University and became the Momoyama branch school.

sen.j: 桃山分校は 1957年4月に廃止となり、現在の伏見区深草藤森町の校地に統合移転した。
sen.e: After Momoyama branch school was discontinued in April 1957, it was merged and relocated to the school land in present Fukakusa Fujinomori-cho, Fushimi Ward
After the Momoyama branch school was discontinued in April 1957, it was merged and relocated to it's current site in Fukakusa Fujinomori-cho, Fushimi Ward
After the Momoyama branch school was discontinued in April 1957, it was merged and relocated to it's current site in Fukakusa Fujinomori-cho, Fushimi Ward

sen.j: 旧桃山校地は、現在は京都教育大学附属桃山中学校の校地となっている。
sen.e: Now, Momoyama Junior High School Attached to Kyoto University of Education is located in the school land of former Momoyama branch school.
Now, the Momoyama Junior High School Attached to the Kyoto University of Education is located in the school land of the former Momoyama branch school.
